title: Authors and Citation
text: Zahn (2023). RVersatransRP: Retrieve format data Versatrans Routing Planning Database.. https://github.com/BostonPublicSchools/RVersatransRP, https://bostonpublicschools.github.io/RVersatransRP/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {RVersatransRP: Retrieve and format data from a Versatrans Routing and Planning Database.},   author = {Ista Zahn},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/BostonPublicSchools/RVersatransRP, https://bostonpublicschools.github.io/RVersatransRP/}, }

what: Retrieve and format data from a Versatrans Routing and Planning Database.
title: Retrieve and format data from a Versatrans Routing and Planning Database.
text: RVersatransRP provides easy use functions querying formatting data Versatrans Routing & Planning database.

title: Retrieve and format data from a Versatrans Routing and Planning Database.
text: development verions RVersatransRP currently available GitHub:

title: Retrieve and format data from a Versatrans Routing and Planning Database.
text: basic example shows retrieve student monitor file Versatrans RP database:
code: library(RVersatransRP) ## or source("RVersatransRP/R/monitors_student_file.R")  student_monitor <- rp_report_student_monitor(database = "Sandbox", format = "long")  ## example pickup data: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union dplyr::glimpse(student_monitor[0,]) #> Rows: 0 #> Columns: 13 #> $ RecordID               <int>  #> $ `Student ID`           <chr>  #> $ `Last, First`          <chr>  #> $ `Program Description`  <chr>  #> $ `INFO WC`              <chr>  #> $ `INFO NEED MONITOR`    <chr>  #> $ `School Abbrev`        <chr>  #> $ `School Anchor Abbrev` <chr>  #> $ `School Name`          <chr>  #> $ Day                    <chr>  #> $ Shift                  <chr>  #> $ Route                  <chr>  #> $ Bus                    <chr>

title: Connect to RP database — rp_connect
text: Establish connection Versatrans Routing Planning database using DBI/odbc packages R.

title: Connect to RP database — rp_connect
code: rp_connect(   rp_odbc_name = Sys.getenv("RP_ODBC_NAME"),   database = Sys.getenv("RP_DATABASE"),   TZ = Sys.timezone(),   conn = NULL )

title: Connect to RP database — rp_connect
text: rp_odbc_name Name Windows ODBC data source use. Retrieved RP_ODBC_NAME environment variable default can overridden , see details. database Name default database connect . Retrieved RP_DATABASE environment variable default can overridden , see details. TZ timezone used database server. conn Existing DBI connection use. NULL (default) new connection opened.

title: Connect to RP database — rp_connect
text: must set ODBC data source Versatrans RP database. must connected BPS network (e.g., via VPN remote). See https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/administer-odbc-data-sources-b19f856b-5b9b-48c9-8b93-07484bfab5a7 #' Connection parameters rp_odbc_name database usually specified .Renviron file, see https://support.posit.co/hc/en-us/articles/360047157094-Managing-R--Rprofile-Renviron-Rprofile-site-Renviron-site-rsession-conf--repos-conf familiar seting envionment variables R.

title: Retrieve RP table — rp_get_table
code: rp_get_table(   conn = NULL,   tablename = c("v_crosstab_student_calc", "StudentInfoFields"),   database = Sys.getenv("RP_DATABASE") )

title: Retrieve RP table — rp_get_table
text: conn DBI connection use, see rp_connect. tablename name table retrieve database Name default database connect . Retrieved RP_DATABASE environment variable default can overridden , see details.

title: Create student monitor report — rp_report_student_monitor
text: Equivalent Import/Export => Student => Monitors student file

title: Create student monitor report — rp_report_student_monitor
text: database Character vector length one specifying database connect format Character vector length one specifying data formatted. "long" (default) return separate rows weekday/pickup/dropoff. "wide" return separate columns weekday/pickup/dropoff.

title: Create student monitor report — rp_report_student_monitor
code: student_monitor <- rp_report_student_monitor()  ## data fields: dplyr::glimpse(student_monitor[0, ]) #> Rows: 0 #> Columns: 13 #> $ RecordID               <int>  #> $ `Student ID`           <chr>  #> $ `Last, First`          <chr>  #> $ `Program Description`  <chr>  #> $ `INFO WC`              <chr>  #> $ `INFO NEED MONITOR`    <chr>  #> $ `School Abbrev`        <chr>  #> $ `School Anchor Abbrev` <chr>  #> $ `School Name`          <chr>  #> $ Day                    <chr>  #> $ Shift                  <chr>  #> $ Route                  <chr>  #> $ Bus                    <chr>

title: Get vehicle override report — rp_report_vehicle_overrides
code: rp_report_vehicle_overrides(   rp_odbc_name = Sys.getenv("RP_ODBC_NAME"),   database = Sys.getenv("OS_DATABASE"),   TZ = Sys.timezone(),   conn = NULL )

title: Get vehicle override report — rp_report_vehicle_overrides
text: rp_odbc_name Name Windows ODBC data source use. Retrieved RP_ODBC_NAME environment variable default can overridden , see details. database Name default database connect . Retrieved RP_DATABASE environment variable default can overridden , see details. TZ timezone used database server. conn Existing DBI connection use. NULL (default) new connection opened.
